reviews.title: Good Hotel located at the end of the world
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Los Nires for 3 nights during our Ushuaia trip. This is a good hotel, located outside of the town center, with a beautiful mountain back drop. The two cons are somewhat significant: our large room window with a view of the mountains also looked out at the hotel restaurant (kind of killed any romance). And the hotel shuttle to the main town only left once an hour or once every two hours. However, if we missed the shuttle, we took a taxi which only cost about 12-13 pesos (or $4 dollars) and the taxi drivers were all rather friendly and fun. So it wasn't a problem at all.

reviews.title: Great Hotel; A Bit Distant
reviews.text: The pros include helpful staff that arranged a tour of the beagle channel through one of the companies located on the pier (made life much easier); big room and comfortable bed; big bathroom; great breakfast; common living room with TV that had english speaking channels. After being away from home for over 2 weeks, we were desperate for some news to catch up on things. The setting was also quite beautiful with mountains in the background.

reviews.title: Amazing view, peaceful surroundings
reviews.text: I spent three nights at the Hotel Los Nires before and after an expedition to Antarctica. The Hotel is very, very clean and comfortable, even if it is a bit far away from downtown Ushuaia.

reviews.title: Two nights in Paradise
reviews.text: My room was very spacious (even by American standards), and the bathroom had just been renovated. In fact the bathroom belongs in a world-class, five-star hotel; complete with travertine tiles, granite, and plenty of counter space.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: The hotel has a retaurant that serves agreeable meals. The menu at dinner has good variety, and the breakfast buffet is quite good.

This is a nice hotel set outside of the city center. At first was concerned about the distance, but the hotel has a free shuttle that is very reliable. Hotel setting is beatiful and located on the water. Our hotel room was large and clean. Breakfast at the restaurant was good, but standard fare. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and also spoke good English.
